lines.text: I was surprised to hear she'd got married at all, I mean she wasn't very attractive was she?
Oh, let's not mince words, Margory, she had a face like a ship's boiler.
Oh, there's a note attached. "My mother and I would be so pleased if you could spend Xmas day with us at the Manor." "Xmas" - makes it sound like a skin complaint.
For what we are about to receive may the Lord make us truly thankful.
Sorry! Um, got a bone in my throat.
Do watch out for bones everybody. You can't be too careful with avocados.
"Since the death of her husband, Audrey has left Grantleigh Manor and moved down the drive." They think I live in a pothole!
When I say I want to know all about pig-breeding, I want to know the full facts. All you've told me here is that pigs are dirty little pink things which go 'Oink!'
We're about to have another lecture, are we?
If that's what you want to call it...
firstly, because you want to prove to everybody that you're still Dame High and Mighty around here and secondly, because you rather enjoy coming over here... to see me.
Democracy is all very well, but why give it to the people?

[Audrey and Brabinger have started their homemade honey business and are tasting their product]
We've made a start. From now on we can only expand.
Especially if we keep eating the honey, madam.

[laughs]
We don't want you to get stuck in the front door like Winnie the Pooh, do we?
We have a saying in old Czechoslovakia.
